Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to remain at the scene of an accident
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether a stay of removal should be granted pending judicial review
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: No evidence of irreparable harm or dependency on the applicant
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate grounds for stay
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Applicant's claims of rehabilitation and family ties considered but not substantiated
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Stay requires serious issue to be tried, irreparable harm, and balance of convenience favoring applicant
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Interlocutory decision subject to discretion of court
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timing of deportation relative to judicial review
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Not reached; application for stay denied
Crimes.Review_Standard: Heald J.A.'s standard for granting stays
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Criminal record, lack of evidence on dependency or irreparable harm
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Canadian immigration law and administrative law principles
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Deportation would undermine rehabilitation and family life
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities with heightened concern for irreparable harm
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Public interest in enforcing immigration laws
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Stay of removal pending judicial review
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Test for interlocutory relief in immigration context

Crimes.Threat_Source: Conduct amounting to wanton or reckless disregard for life
Crimes.Prior_Criminality: Yes, multiple convictions including impaired driving
Crimes.Criminality_Severity: High – constitutes serious criminality under IRPA
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Sufficient to support conviction and deportation order
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Beyond reasonable doubt (criminal), balance of probabilities (immigration)
Crimes.Sentencing_Issue: Length of sentence indicative of seriousness
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Timing of removal vs. availability of judicial review
Crimes.Review_Mechanism: Judicial review under Rule 383 of Immigration Rules
Crimes.Decision_Standard: Reasonableness and compliance with procedural fairness

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether deportation pending judicial review causes irreparable harm
Crimes.Governing_Law: IRPA and Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Crimes.Procedural_Stage: Pending judicial review of H&C decision
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: No proof of irreparable harm; ability to return if successful on review
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to show irreparable harm
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Claims of rehabilitation and family disruption not supported by evidence
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Three-part test for stay: serious issue, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Discretionary, based on Heald J.A.'s criteria
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Overlap between removal timeline and judicial review process
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Humanitarian and compassionate grounds based on family and rehabilitation
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Not decided; stay denied on procedural grounds
Crimes.Review_Standard: Heald J.A.'s standard for interim relief
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Process found to be fair and lawful
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Conviction history, absence of dependency or severe hardship
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Removal undermines rehabilitation and family life
Crimes.Court_Result: Stay denied, removal allowed to proceed
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities with emphasis on irreparable harm
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Enforcement of immigration laws serves public interest
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Suspension of removal pending final decision
Crimes.Resolution_Mechanism: Motion for stay during judicial review
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Serious criminality due to impaired driving conviction
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Test for granting interim relief in immigration cases
